CancelImageCreation.name: CancelImageCreation
CancelImageCreation.documentation: CancelImageCreation cancels the creation of Image. This operation can only be used on images in a non-terminal state.

CreateComponent.name: CreateComponent
CreateComponent.documentation: Creates a new component that can be used to build, validate, test, and assess your image.

CreateContainerRecipe.name: CreateContainerRecipe
CreateContainerRecipe.documentation: Creates a new container recipe. Container recipes define how images are configured, tested, and assessed.

CreateDistributionConfiguration.name: CreateDistributionConfiguration
CreateDistributionConfiguration.documentation: Creates a new distribution configuration. Distribution configurations define and configure the outputs of your pipeline.

CreateImage.name: CreateImage
CreateImage.documentation: Creates a new image. This request will create a new image along with all of the configured output resources defined in the distribution configuration.

CreateImagePipeline.name: CreateImagePipeline
CreateImagePipeline.documentation: Creates a new image pipeline. Image pipelines enable you to automate the creation and distribution of images.

CreateImageRecipe.name: CreateImageRecipe
CreateImageRecipe.documentation: Creates a new image recipe. Image recipes define how images are configured, tested, and assessed.

CreateInfrastructureConfiguration.name: CreateInfrastructureConfiguration
CreateInfrastructureConfiguration.documentation: Creates a new infrastructure configuration. An infrastructure configuration defines the environment in which your image will be built and tested.

GetContainerRecipePolicy.name: GetContainerRecipePolicy
GetContainerRecipePolicy.documentation: Retrieves the policy for a container recipe.

ImportComponent.name: ImportComponent
ImportComponent.documentation: Imports a component and transforms its data into a component document.

ListComponentBuildVersions.name: ListComponentBuildVersions
ListComponentBuildVersions.documentation: Returns the list of component build versions for the specified semantic version.

ListComponents.name: ListComponents
ListComponents.documentation: Returns the list of component build versions for the specified semantic version.

ListImageBuildVersions.name: ListImageBuildVersions
ListImageBuildVersions.documentation: Returns a list of image build versions.

ListImagePipelineImages.name: ListImagePipelineImages
ListImagePipelineImages.documentation: Returns a list of images created by the specified pipeline.

ListImageRecipes.name: ListImageRecipes
ListImageRecipes.documentation: Returns a list of image recipes.

ListImages.name: ListImages
ListImages.documentation: Returns the list of images that you have access to.

ListInfrastructureConfigurations.name: ListInfrastructureConfigurations
ListInfrastructureConfigurations.documentation: Returns a list of infrastructure configurations.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: Returns the list of tags for the specified resource.

PutComponentPolicy.name: PutComponentPolicy
PutComponentPolicy.documentation: Applies a policy to a component. We recommend that you call the RAM API CreateResourceShare to share resources. If you call the Image Builder API PutComponentPolicy, you must also call the RAM API PromoteResourceShareCreatedFromPolicy in order for the resource to be visible to all principals with whom the resource is shared.

PutContainerRecipePolicy.name: PutContainerRecipePolicy
PutContainerRecipePolicy.documentation: Applies a policy to a container image. We recommend that you call the RAM API CreateResourceShare (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/ram/latest/APIReference/API_CreateResourceShare.html) to share resources. If you call the Image Builder API PutContainerImagePolicy, you must also call the RAM API PromoteResourceShareCreatedFromPolicy (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/ram/latest/APIReference/API_PromoteResourceShareCreatedFromPolicy.html) in order for the resource to be visible to all principals with whom the resource is shared.

PutImagePolicy.name: PutImagePolicy
PutImagePolicy.documentation: Applies a policy to an image. We recommend that you call the RAM API CreateResourceShare to share resources. If you call the Image Builder API PutImagePolicy, you must also call the RAM API PromoteResourceShareCreatedFromPolicy in order for the resource to be visible to all principals with whom the resource is shared.

PutImageRecipePolicy.name: PutImageRecipePolicy
PutImageRecipePolicy.documentation: Applies a policy to an image recipe. We recommend that you call the RAM API CreateResourceShare to share resources. If you call the Image Builder API PutImageRecipePolicy, you must also call the RAM API PromoteResourceShareCreatedFromPolicy in order for the resource to be visible to all principals with whom the resource is shared.

StartImagePipelineExecution.name: StartImagePipelineExecution
StartImagePipelineExecution.documentation: Manually triggers a pipeline to create an image.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation: Adds a tag to a resource.

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation: Removes a tag from a resource.

UpdateDistributionConfiguration.name: UpdateDistributionConfiguration
UpdateDistributionConfiguration.documentation: Updates a new distribution configuration. Distribution configurations define and configure the outputs of your pipeline.

UpdateImagePipeline.name: UpdateImagePipeline
UpdateImagePipeline.documentation: Updates a new image pipeline. Image pipelines enable you to automate the creation and distribution of images.

UpdateInfrastructureConfiguration.name: UpdateInfrastructureConfiguration
UpdateInfrastructureConfiguration.documentation: Updates a new infrastructure configuration. An infrastructure configuration defines the environment in which your image will be built and tested.

region.documentation: The AWS Region of the EC2 AMI.

image.documentation: The AMI ID of the EC2 AMI.

description.documentation: The description of the EC2 AMI. Minimum and maximum length are in characters.

accountId.documentation: The account ID of the owner of the AMI.

description.documentation: The description of the distribution configuration. Minimum and maximum length are in characters.

targetAccountIds.documentation: The ID of an account to which you want to distribute an image.

amiTags.documentation: The tags to apply to AMIs distributed to this Region.

kmsKeyId.documentation: The KMS key identifier used to encrypt the distributed image.

launchPermission.documentation: Launch permissions can be used to configure which AWS accounts can use the AMI to launch instances.

AmiDistributionConfiguration.documentation: Define and configure the output AMIs of the pipeline.

CallRateLimitExceededException.documentation: You have exceeded the permitted request rate for the specific operation.

imageBuildVersionArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image whose creation you want to cancel.

clientToken.documentation: The idempotency token used to make this request idempotent.

requestId.documentation: The request ID that uniquely identifies this request.

clientToken.documentation: The idempotency token used to make this request idempotent.

imageBuildVersionArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image whose creation has been cancelled.

ClientException.documentation: These errors are usually caused by a client action, such as using an action or resource on behalf of a user that doesn't have permissions to use the action or resource, or specifying an invalid resource identifier.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component.

type.documentation: The type of the component denotes whether the component is used to build the image or only to test it.

supportedOsVersions.documentation: The operating system (OS) version supported by the component. If the OS information is available, a prefix match is performed against the parent image OS version during image recipe creation.

kmsKeyId.documentation: The KMS key identifier used to encrypt the component.

dateCreated.documentation: The date that the component was created.

componentArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component.

supportedOsVersions.documentation: The operating system (OS) version supported by the component. If the OS information is available, a prefix match is performed against the parent image OS version during image recipe creation.

type.documentation: The type of the component denotes whether the component is used to build the image or only to test it.

dateCreated.documentation: The date that the component was created.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component.

supportedOsVersions.documentation: The operating system (OS) version supported by the component. If the OS information is available, a prefix match is performed against the parent image OS version during image recipe creation.

type.documentation: The type of the component denotes whether the component is used to build the image or only to test it.

dateCreated.documentation: The date that the component was created.

ComponentVersion.documentation: A high-level overview of a component semantic version.

region.documentation: Containers and container images are Region-specific. This is the Region context for the container.

imageUris.documentation: A list of URIs for containers created in the context Region.

Container.documentation: A container encapsulates the runtime environment for an application.

description.documentation: The description of the container distribution configuration.

containerTags.documentation: Tags that are attached to the container distribution configuration.

targetRepository.documentation: The destination repository for the container distribution configuration.

ContainerDistributionConfiguration.documentation: Container distribution settings for encryption, licensing, and sharing in a specific Region.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container recipe.

containerType.documentation: Specifies the type of container, such as Docker.

platform.documentation: The system platform for the container, such as Windows or Linux.

version.documentation: The semantic version of the container recipe (<major>.<minor>.<patch>).

components.documentation: Components for build and test that are included in the container recipe.

dockerfileTemplateData.documentation: Dockerfiles are text documents that are used to build Docker containers, and ensure that they contain all of the elements required by the application running inside. The template data consists of contextual variables where Image Builder places build information or scripts, based on your container image recipe.

kmsKeyId.documentation: Identifies which KMS key is used to encrypt the container image for distribution to the target Region.

encrypted.documentation: A flag that indicates if the target container is encrypted.

parentImage.documentation: The source image for the container recipe.

dateCreated.documentation: The date when this container recipe was created.

tags.documentation: Tags that are attached to the container recipe.

workingDirectory.documentation: The working directory for use during build and test workflows.

targetRepository.documentation: The destination repository for the container image.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container recipe.

containerType.documentation: Specifies the type of container, such as "Docker".

platform.documentation: The system platform for the container, such as Windows or Linux.

parentImage.documentation: The source image for the container recipe.

dateCreated.documentation: The date when this container recipe was created.

tags.documentation: Tags that are attached to the container recipe.

semanticVersion.documentation: The semantic version of the component. This version follows the semantic version syntax. For example, major.minor.patch. This could be versioned like software (2.0.1) or like a date (2019.12.01).

description.documentation: The description of the component. Describes the contents of the component.

changeDescription.documentation: The change description of the component. Describes what change has been made in this version, or what makes this version different from other versions of this component.

supportedOsVersions.documentation: The operating system (OS) version supported by the component. If the OS information is available, a prefix match is performed against the parent image OS version during image recipe creation.

data.documentation: The data of the component. Used to specify the data inline. Either data or uri can be used to specify the data within the component.

uri.documentation: The uri of the component. Must be an S3 URL and the requester must have permission to access the S3 bucket. If you use S3, you can specify component content up to your service quota. Either data or uri can be used to specify the data within the component.

kmsKeyId.documentation: The ID of the KMS key that should be used to encrypt this component.

clientToken.documentation: The idempotency token of the component.

requestId.documentation: The request ID that uniquely identifies this request.

clientToken.documentation: The idempotency token used to make this request idempotent.

componentBuildVersionArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component that was created by this request.

semanticVersion.documentation: The semantic version of the container recipe (<major>.<minor>.<patch>).

components.documentation: Components for build and test that are included in the container recipe.

dockerfileTemplateData.documentation: The Dockerfile template used to build your image as an inline data blob.

dockerfileTemplateUri.documentation: The S3 URI for the Dockerfile that will be used to build your container image.

platformOverride.documentation: Specifies the operating system platform when you use a custom source image.

imageOsVersionOverride.documentation: Specifies the operating system version for the source image.

parentImage.documentation: The source image for the container recipe.

tags.documentation: Tags that are attached to the container recipe.

workingDirectory.documentation: The working directory for use during build and test workflows.

targetRepository.documentation: The destination repository for the container image.

kmsKeyId.documentation: Identifies which KMS key is used to encrypt the container image.

clientToken.documentation: The client token used to make this request idempotent.

containerRecipeArn.documentation: Returns the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container recipe that the request created.

description.documentation: The description of the distribution configuration.

distributions.documentation: The distributions of the distribution configuration.

name.documentation: The name of the image pipeline.

description.documentation: The description of the image pipeline.

imageRecipeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image recipe that will be used to configure images created by this image pipeline.

containerRecipeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container recipe that is used to configure images created by this container pipeline.

infrastructureConfigurationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the infrastructure configuration that will be used to build images created by this image pipeline.

distributionConfigurationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the distribution configuration that will be used to configure and distribute images created by this image pipeline.

imageTestsConfiguration.documentation: The image test configuration of the image pipeline.

enhancedImageMetadataEnabled.documentation: Collects additional information about the image being created, including the operating system (OS) version and package list. This information is used to enhance the overall experience of using EC2 Image Builder. Enabled by default.

schedule.documentation: The schedule of the image pipeline.

status.documentation: The status of the image pipeline.

tags.documentation: The tags of the image pipeline.

clientToken.documentation: The idempotency token used to make this request idempotent.

requestId.documentation: The request ID that uniquely identifies this request.

clientToken.documentation: The idempotency token used to make this request idempotent.

imagePipelineArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image pipeline that was created by this request.

name.documentation: The name of the image recipe.

description.documentation: The description of the image recipe.

semanticVersion.documentation: The semantic version of the image recipe.

parentImage.documentation: The parent image of the image recipe. The value of the string can be the ARN of the parent image or an AMI ID. The format for the ARN follows this example: arn:aws:imagebuilder:us-west-2:aws:image/windows-server-2016-english-full-base-x86/xxxx.x.x. You can provide the specific version that you want to use, or you can use a wildcard in all of the fields. If you enter an AMI ID for the string value, you must have access to the AMI, and the AMI must be in the same Region in which you are using Image Builder.

blockDeviceMappings.documentation: The block device mappings of the image recipe.

tags.documentation: The tags of the image recipe.

workingDirectory.documentation: The working directory to be used during build and test workflows.

imageRecipeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image recipe that was created by this request.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image recipe that defines how images are configured, tested, and assessed.

containerRecipeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container recipe that defines how images are configured and tested.

distributionConfigurationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the distribution configuration that defines and configures the outputs of your pipeline.

infrastructureConfigurationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the infrastructure configuration that defines the environment in which your image will be built and tested.

imageTestsConfiguration.documentation: The image tests configuration of the image.

enhancedImageMetadataEnabled.documentation: Collects additional information about the image being created, including the operating system (OS) version and package list. This information is used to enhance the overall experience of using EC2 Image Builder. Enabled by default.

instanceTypes.documentation: The instance types of the infrastructure configuration. You can specify one or more instance types to use for this build. The service will pick one of these instance types based on availability.

instanceProfileName.documentation: The instance profile to associate with the instance used to customize your EC2 AMI.

securityGroupIds.documentation: The security group IDs to associate with the instance used to customize your EC2 AMI.

subnetId.documentation: The subnet ID in which to place the instance used to customize your EC2 AMI.

logging.documentation: The logging configuration of the infrastructure configuration.

keyPair.documentation: The key pair of the infrastructure configuration. This can be used to log on to and debug the instance used to create your image.

terminateInstanceOnFailure.documentation: The terminate instance on failure setting of the infrastructure configuration. Set to false if you want Image Builder to retain the instance used to configure your AMI if the build or test phase of your workflow fails.

snsTopicArn.documentation: The SNS topic on which to send image build events.

resourceTags.documentation: The tags attached to the resource created by Image Builder.

amiDistributionConfiguration.documentation: The specific AMI settings (for example, launch permissions, AMI tags).

containerDistributionConfiguration.documentation: Container distribution settings for encryption, licensing, and sharing in a specific Region.

licenseConfigurationArns.documentation: The License Manager Configuration to associate with the AMI in the specified Region.

Distribution.documentation: Defines the settings for a specific Region.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the distribution configuration.

timeoutMinutes.documentation: The maximum duration in minutes for this distribution configuration.

dateCreated.documentation: The date on which this distribution configuration was created.

dateUpdated.documentation: The date on which this distribution configuration was last updated.

deleteOnTermination.documentation: Use to configure delete on termination of the associated device.

kmsKeyId.documentation: Use to configure the KMS key to use when encrypting the device.

snapshotId.documentation: The snapshot that defines the device contents.

volumeSize.documentation: Use to override the device's volume size.

volumeType.documentation: Use to override the device's volume type.

name.documentation: The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive.

values.documentation: The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive.

Filter.documentation: A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a list operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs.

IdempotentParameterMismatchException.documentation: You have specified a client token for an operation using parameter values that differ from a previous request that used the same client token.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image.

type.documentation: Specifies whether this is an AMI or container image.

enhancedImageMetadataEnabled.documentation: Collects additional information about the image being created, including the operating system (OS) version and package list. This information is used to enhance the overall experience of using EC2 Image Builder. Enabled by default.

osVersion.documentation: The operating system version of the instance. For example, Amazon Linux 2, Ubuntu 18, or Microsoft Windows Server 2019.

imageRecipe.documentation: The image recipe used when creating the image.

containerRecipe.documentation: The container recipe used to create the container image type.

sourcePipelineName.documentation: The name of the image pipeline that created this image.

sourcePipelineArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image pipeline that created this image.

infrastructureConfiguration.documentation: The infrastructure used when creating this image.

distributionConfiguration.documentation: The distribution configuration used when creating this image.

imageTestsConfiguration.documentation: The image tests configuration used when creating this image.

dateCreated.documentation: The date on which this image was created.

outputResources.documentation: The output resources produced when creating this image.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image pipeline.

enhancedImageMetadataEnabled.documentation: Collects additional information about the image being created, including the operating system (OS) version and package list. This information is used to enhance the overall experience of using EC2 Image Builder. Enabled by default.

imageRecipeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image recipe associated with this image pipeline.

containerRecipeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container recipe that is used for this pipeline.

infrastructureConfigurationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the infrastructure configuration associated with this image pipeline.

distributionConfigurationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the distribution configuration associated with this image pipeline.

imageTestsConfiguration.documentation: The image tests configuration of the image pipeline.

dateCreated.documentation: The date on which this image pipeline was created.

dateUpdated.documentation: The date on which this image pipeline was last updated.

dateLastRun.documentation: The date on which this image pipeline was last run.

dateNextRun.documentation: The date on which this image pipeline will next be run.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image recipe.

type.documentation: Specifies which type of image is created by the recipe - an AMI or a container image.

parentImage.documentation: The parent image of the image recipe.

blockDeviceMappings.documentation: The block device mappings to apply when creating images from this recipe.

dateCreated.documentation: The date on which this image recipe was created.

workingDirectory.documentation: The working directory to be used during build and test workflows.

parentImage.documentation: The parent image of the image recipe.

dateCreated.documentation: The date on which this image recipe was created.

ImageState.documentation: Image state shows the image status and the reason for that status.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image.

type.documentation: Specifies whether this is an AMI or container image.

osVersion.documentation: The operating system version of the instance. For example, Amazon Linux 2, Ubuntu 18, or Microsoft Windows Server 2019.

dateCreated.documentation: The date on which this image was created.

outputResources.documentation: The output resources produced when creating this image.

imageTestsEnabled.documentation: Defines if tests should be executed when building this image.

timeoutMinutes.documentation: The maximum time in minutes that tests are permitted to run.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image semantic version.

name.documentation: The name of the image semantic version.

type.documentation: Specifies whether this is an AMI or container image.

version.documentation: The semantic version of the image semantic version.

platform.documentation: The platform of the image semantic version.

osVersion.documentation: The operating system version of the instance. For example, Amazon Linux 2, Ubuntu 18, or Microsoft Windows Server 2019.

owner.documentation: The owner of the image semantic version.

dateCreated.documentation: The date at which this image semantic version was created.

semanticVersion.documentation: The semantic version of the component. This version follows the semantic version syntax. For example, major.minor.patch. This could be versioned like software (2.0.1) or like a date (2019.12.01).

description.documentation: The description of the component. Describes the contents of the component.

changeDescription.documentation: The change description of the component. Describes what change has been made in this version, or what makes this version different from other versions of this component.

type.documentation: The type of the component denotes whether the component is used to build the image or only to test it.

format.documentation: The format of the resource that you want to import as a component.

data.documentation: The data of the component. Used to specify the data inline. Either data or uri can be used to specify the data within the component.

uri.documentation: The uri of the component. Must be an S3 URL and the requester must have permission to access the S3 bucket. If you use S3, you can specify component content up to your service quota. Either data or uri can be used to specify the data within the component.

kmsKeyId.documentation: The ID of the KMS key that should be used to encrypt this component.

clientToken.documentation: The idempotency token of the component.

requestId.documentation: The request ID that uniquely identifies this request.

componentBuildVersionArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the imported component.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the infrastructure configuration.

instanceTypes.documentation: The instance types of the infrastructure configuration.

instanceProfileName.documentation: The instance profile of the infrastructure configuration.

securityGroupIds.documentation: The security group IDs of the infrastructure configuration.

subnetId.documentation: The subnet ID of the infrastructure configuration.

logging.documentation: The logging configuration of the infrastructure configuration.

keyPair.documentation: The EC2 key pair of the infrastructure configuration.

terminateInstanceOnFailure.documentation: The terminate instance on failure configuration of the infrastructure configuration.

snsTopicArn.documentation: The SNS topic Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the infrastructure configuration.

dateUpdated.documentation: The date on which the infrastructure configuration was last updated.

resourceTags.documentation: The tags attached to the resource created by Image Builder.

dateUpdated.documentation: The date on which the infrastructure configuration was last updated.

resourceTags.documentation: The tags attached to the image created by Image Builder.

InfrastructureConfigurationSummary.documentation: The infrastructure used when building EC2 AMIs.

deviceName.documentation: The device to which these mappings apply.

ebs.documentation: Use to manage Amazon EBS-specific configuration for this mapping.

noDevice.documentation: Use to remove a mapping from the parent image.

InstanceBlockDeviceMapping.documentation: Defines block device mappings for the instance used to configure your image.

InvalidPaginationTokenException.documentation: You have provided an invalid pagination token in your request.

InvalidParameterCombinationException.documentation: You have specified two or more mutually exclusive parameters. Review the error message for details.

InvalidParameterException.documentation: The specified parameter is invalid. Review the available parameters for the API request.

InvalidParameterValueException.documentation: The value that you provided for the specified parameter is invalid.

InvalidRequestException.documentation: You have made a request for an action that is not supported by the service.

InvalidVersionNumberException.documentation: Your version number is out of bounds or does not follow the required syntax.

LaunchPermissionConfiguration.documentation: Describes the configuration for a launch permission. The launch permission modification request is sent to the EC2 ModifyImageAttribute API on behalf of the user for each Region they have selected to distribute the AMI. To make an AMI public, set the launch permission authorized accounts to all. See the examples for making an AMI public at EC2 ModifyImageAttribute.

componentVersionArn.documentation: The component version Amazon Resource Name (ARN) whose versions you want to list.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum items to return in a request.

nextToken.documentation: A token to specify where to start paginating. This is the NextToken from a previously truncated response.

requestId.documentation: The request ID that uniquely identifies this request.

componentSummaryList.documentation: The list of component summaries for the specified semantic version.

nextToken.documentation: The next token used for paginated responses. When this is not empty, there are additional elements that the service has not included in this request. Use this token with the next request to retrieve additional objects.

owner.documentation: The owner defines which components you want to list. By default, this request will only show components owned by your account. You can use this field to specify if you want to view components owned by yourself, by Amazon, or those components that have been shared with you by other customers.

byName.documentation: Returns the list of component build versions for the specified semantic version.

owner.documentation: Returns container recipes belonging to the specified owner, that have been shared with you. You can omit this field to return container recipes belonging to your account.

filters.documentation: Request filters that are used to narrow the list of container images that are returned.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in the list.

nextToken.documentation: Provides a token for pagination, which determines where to begin the next set of results when the current set reaches the maximum for one request.

You can use this field to specify if you want to view image recipes owned by yourself, by Amazon, or those image recipes that have been shared with you by other customers.

Logging.documentation: Logging configuration defines where Image Builder uploads your logs.

amis.documentation: The EC2 AMIs created by this image.

containers.documentation: Container images that the pipeline has generated and stored in the output repository.

componentArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component that this policy should be applied to.

requestId.documentation: The request ID that uniquely identifies this request.

componentArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component that this policy was applied to.

containerRecipeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container recipe that this policy should be applied to.

policy.documentation: The policy to apply to the container recipe.

requestId.documentation: The request ID that uniquely identifies this request.

containerRecipeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container recipe that this policy was applied to.

imageArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image that this policy should be applied to.

requestId.documentation: The request ID that uniquely identifies this request.

imageArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image that this policy was applied to.

imageRecipeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image recipe that this policy should be applied to.

requestId.documentation: The request ID that uniquely identifies this request.

imageRecipeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image recipe that this policy was applied to.

ResourceAlreadyExistsException.documentation: The resource that you are trying to create already exists.

ResourceDependencyException.documentation: You have attempted to mutate or delete a resource with a dependency that prohibits this action. See the error message for more details.

ResourceInUseException.documentation: The resource that you are trying to operate on is currently in use. Review the message details and retry later.

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: At least one of the resources referenced by your request does not exist.

s3BucketName.documentation: The Amazon S3 bucket in which to store the logs.

s3KeyPrefix.documentation: The Amazon S3 path in which to store the logs.

scheduleExpression.documentation:
The cron expression determines how often EC2 Image Builder evaluates your pipelineExecutionStartCondition.

For information on how to format a cron expression in Image Builder, see Use cron expressions in EC2 Image Builder.

pipelineExecutionStartCondition.documentation: The condition configures when the pipeline should trigger a new image build. When the pipelineExecutionStartCondition is set to EXPRESSION_MATCH_AND_DEPENDENCY_UPDATES_AVAILABLE, and you use semantic version filters on the source image or components in your image recipe, EC2 Image Builder will build a new image only when there are new versions of the image or components in your recipe that match the semantic version filter. When it is set to EXPRESSION_MATCH_ONLY, it will build a new image every time the CRON expression matches the current time. For semantic version syntax, see CreateComponent in the EC2 Image Builder API Reference.

Schedule.documentation: A schedule configures how often and when a pipeline will automatically create a new image.

ServiceException.documentation: This exception is thrown when the service encounters an unrecoverable exception.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.documentation: You have exceeded the number of permitted resources or operations for this service. For service quotas, see EC2 Image Builder endpoints and quotas.

ServiceUnavailableException.documentation: The service is unable to process your request at this time.

imagePipelineArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image pipeline that you want to manually invoke.

clientToken.documentation: The idempotency token used to make this request idempotent.

requestId.documentation: The request ID that uniquely identifies this request.

clientToken.documentation: The idempotency token used to make this request idempotent.

imageBuildVersionArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image that was created by this request.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to tag.

tags.documentation: The tags to apply to the resource.

service.documentation: Specifies the service in which this image was registered.

repositoryName.documentation: The name of the container repository where the output container image is stored. This name is prefixed by the repository location.

TargetContainerRepository.documentation: The container repository where the output container image is stored.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to untag.

tagKeys.documentation: The tag keys to remove from the resource.

distributionConfigurationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the distribution configuration that you want to update.

clientToken.documentation: The idempotency token of the distribution configuration.

requestId.documentation: The request ID that uniquely identifies this request.

clientToken.documentation: The idempotency token used to make this request idempotent.

distributionConfigurationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the distribution configuration that was updated by this request.

imagePipelineArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image pipeline that you want to update.

imageRecipeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image recipe that will be used to configure images updated by this image pipeline.

containerRecipeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container pipeline to update.

infrastructureConfigurationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the infrastructure configuration that will be used to build images updated by this image pipeline.

distributionConfigurationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the distribution configuration that will be used to configure and distribute images updated by this image pipeline.

imageTestsConfiguration.documentation: The image test configuration of the image pipeline.

enhancedImageMetadataEnabled.documentation: Collects additional information about the image being created, including the operating system (OS) version and package list. This information is used to enhance the overall experience of using EC2 Image Builder. Enabled by default.

clientToken.documentation: The idempotency token used to make this request idempotent.

requestId.documentation: The request ID that uniquely identifies this request.

clientToken.documentation: The idempotency token used to make this request idempotent.

imagePipelineArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image pipeline that was updated by this request.

infrastructureConfigurationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the infrastructure configuration that you want to update.

instanceTypes.documentation: The instance types of the infrastructure configuration. You can specify one or more instance types to use for this build. The service will pick one of these instance types based on availability.

instanceProfileName.documentation: The instance profile to associate with the instance used to customize your EC2 AMI.

securityGroupIds.documentation: The security group IDs to associate with the instance used to customize your EC2 AMI.

subnetId.documentation: The subnet ID to place the instance used to customize your EC2 AMI in.

logging.documentation: The logging configuration of the infrastructure configuration.

keyPair.documentation: The key pair of the infrastructure configuration. This can be used to log on to and debug the instance used to create your image.

terminateInstanceOnFailure.documentation: The terminate instance on failure setting of the infrastructure configuration. Set to false if you want Image Builder to retain the instance used to configure your AMI if the build or test phase of your workflow fails.

snsTopicArn.documentation: The SNS topic on which to send image build events.

clientToken.documentation: The idempotency token used to make this request idempotent.

resourceTags.documentation: The tags attached to the resource created by Image Builder.

requestId.documentation: The request ID that uniquely identifies this request.

clientToken.documentation: The idempotency token used to make this request idempotent.

infrastructureConfigurationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the infrastructure configuration that was updated by this request.

documentation: EC2 Image Builder is a fully managed AWS service that makes it easier to automate the creation, management, and deployment of customized, secure, and up-to-date "golden" server images that are pre-installed and pre-configured with software and settings to meet specific IT standards.
